info.title: Hi there!
info.description:
The Bitcoin Design Community is organising a designathon! Imagine a traditional hackathon, but this time focused only on design. Our goal is to motivate designers and builders to get together and collaboratively explore ideas and concepts in and around the bitcoin ecosystem. The designathon will happen in coordination with the Bolt.fun Legends of Lightning tournament, and we are working on coordinating with the TABConf Builder Day

For updates, join us on Slack in the #designathon channel, and on Twitter.

sponsors.title: Interested in sponsoring prizes?
sponsors.description: We want to thank participants of the designathon with a token of gratitude for their efforts and are looking for sponsors. Find more information at the link below.

Anyone! Innovation is created by exploring creativity and this is exactly your place to do that. Feel free to stretch your creative side or explore a design concept that you‚Äôve had.

We‚Äôd love to involve anyone that wants to take part, from designers and developers, PM‚Äôs and consultants, to total noobs. Everyone is welcome!

questions.q: When and where will it take place?
questions.a:
The bitcoin designathon will take place online between 12th-23rd October (Wed-Sun).

All communications, project setup, news, updates, schedules, mentorship, and everything else will take place inside of Bitcoin Design Slack channel, feel free to hop in and say hi üëã to other makers, begin forming project teams, and discuss ideas. This website will be updated as well.

Workshops and talks will be streamed on the Bitcoin Design Youtube Channel, so you can join us live or catch up in your own time!

Our first few days will be dedicated to ensuring all makers are matched up with projects. You can also choose to work on your project alone, totally up to you! The remainder of the event will be free and open for you to explore your design creativity.

Next to that there will be live workshops you can join such as how to do remote design sprints, an intro to Figma and the Bitcoin UI Kit, research as well as some technical topics. If you would like to host a call or workshop, reach out in the #designathon Slack channel.

On the final day makers will submit their projects for review and will have a chance to present them live to the community. We are still sorting out whether there will be prizes.

questions.q: This is my first time joining a hackathon, will there be help?
questions.a:
Our first few days of the designathon will be dedicated to providing makers with some amazing workshops. We will also provide guidance in terms of online tutorials and resources you can use to enjoy your design journey.

This should provide some good tools and resources for you to start designing and most importantly having fun! Next to that our Slack channel is always open for you to post your question and we will gladly direct you to any additional help you may need.

questions.q: Looking for a project to hack on?
questions.a:
Looking for a project to join? Jump into our Slack and introduce yourself in our #designathon channel. Let other makers know who you are, where you‚Äôre from, what skills, resources, and time you can offer, plus what you‚Äôre excited to design!

Teams will organise themselves. We suggest including a variety of backgrounds and skill sets, which typically creates better results. Some participants could be more design focussed, others more technical, or artists, it totally depends on what you are working on.

Design projects will be judged on the following criteria:

  • üåà Innovation
    The design should be something new and never seen before in the bitcoin space. This can be a brand new concept, or a fresh take on something we already know.

  • ‚ö° Bitcoin Integration
    The design should make intelligent use of bitcoin (and/or surrounding technologies like lightning).

  • üëÄ Open design
    Encouraging designers to work and collaborate in public. Has the team been transparent throughout their design journey?

  • ‚úÖ Execution
    Designers should focus on attention to detail. How well has the project been executed? How strong was their design process?

  • üçí UI/UX Design
    The design follows good design principles and is well-crafted. How well has the application or feature been designed?

  • üî• Je ne sais quoi
    The design should have an extra level of pizazz, personality, creativity, or coolness.

questions.q: Is my idea appropriate for the designathon?
questions.a:
The bitcoin designation is open to anything your mind can imagine. If you have an idea in mind and are wondering if it would be a great fit for the designathon. Below you‚Äôll find a list of idea categories which might help!

  • Education - how can we make bitcoin easier to understand and start using for more people around the world?

  • Games - what are some unique playful experiences that can only be built on bitcoin?

  • Future tech - how will we use bitcoin a few years from now when Taro, Fedimint, Taproot and other advancements are broadly adopted?

  • Adoption - how can we as a community get the current tech to more people in new, interesting, and useful ways?

  • Inclusion - explore how bitcoin reach more people by improving aspects like accessibility and localization

  • Finance - how can bitcoin be used in finance beyond payments and savings (RoboSats, LN Markets, Stable coins on Taro, etc)?

  • How can bitcoin wallets enable decentralised identities (see Sign in with bitcoin)

  • Solve design problems or think of new experiences around Lightning

  • Explore designs and interaction models around hardware wallets

  • Use cases in your personal context (for your kids, people in your community, inheritance)

  • Art - this one is up to you to define

If your idea doesn‚Äôt fit in these categories, no worries, just go for it. As long as it‚Äôs related to bitcoin in some way, it‚Äôs all in good order.

ideas.title: Ideas
ideas.description: It all starts with ideas. In the time leading up to the designathon, we invite you to submit your ideas. They can turn into projects for you and/or others to collaborate on during the designathon. After a super quick review (more on this here), idea submissions will appear below.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Projects are how we organize and collaborate during the designathon. Anyone can form a project with an idea they would like to work on, independently or with others. Once we are closer to the start date, we will open up registrations for projects. Keep an eye on this spot.

partners.title: Co-mingle
partners.description: The designathon starts at the same time as several other events. Those are great opportunities to meet others, find interesting projects, help out, etc.

partners.name: Bolt.fun Legends of Lightning tournament
partners.description: Enter your project into this 2-month online global tournament and compete for prizes of up to ~$60,000 in bitcoin. Or if you are already part of the tournament, use the designathon to get design support.

partners.name: TABConf
partners.description: Stephen will host a Bitcoin Design table at the TABConf Builder Day, which starts the same day as the designathon. Stop by and hack on your designathon project.

partners.name: Bitcoin Amsterdam
partners.description: Several members of the Bitcoin Design Community will be attending this conference, which also starts the same day as the designathon. Say hi and let's kick off the events together.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Other than the kick-off and wrap-up, there is no fixed schedule. We put together a few open work sessions and workshops. If you‚Äôd like to list an event here, reach out on Slack.
